name: jupyter-mcp-server
description: Connect AI agents to Jupyter Notebooks - execute code, manage notebooks, and interact with kernels in real-time
long_description:
The Jupyter MCP Server enables AI agents like Claude to connect to and manage Jupyter Notebooks in real-time. It provides 14 tools to execute code, manage notebooks, read and write cells, and interact with Jupyter kernels through the standardized Model Context Protocol.

**Requirements:** You need a running Jupyter server (JupyterLab or Jupyter Notebook) to connect to. Start one with:
```
pip install jupyterlab
jupyter lab --port 8888 --IdentityProvider.token MY_TOKEN
```

tools.name: list_files
tools.description: List files and directories in the Jupyter server filesystem

tools.name: list_kernels
tools.description: List all available and running kernel sessions

tools.name: use_notebook
tools.description: Connect to an existing notebook or create a new one

tools.name: list_notebooks
tools.description: List all managed notebooks and their status

tools.name: restart_notebook
tools.description: Restart the kernel for a managed notebook

tools.name: unuse_notebook
tools.description: Disconnect from a notebook and release resources

tools.name: read_notebook
tools.description: Read notebook content with brief or detailed format

tools.name: read_cell
tools.description: Read full content of a single cell including metadata and outputs

tools.name: insert_cell
tools.description: Insert new code or markdown cells into a notebook

tools.name: delete_cell
tools.description: Delete cells from a notebook by index

tools.name: overwrite_cell_source
tools.description: Modify the source code of a notebook cell

tools.name: execute_cell
tools.description: Execute a notebook cell with timeout and multimodal output support

tools.name: insert_execute_code_cell
tools.description: Insert and execute a code cell in one step

tools.name: execute_code
tools.description: Execute arbitrary code directly in the kernel

jupyter_url.title: Jupyter Server URL
jupyter_url.description: URL of your running Jupyter server (e.g., http://localhost:8888)

jupyter_token.title: Jupyter Server Token
jupyter_token.description: Authentication token for your Jupyter server
